Title: short film in CLO & UE5 by @yuri.arouca
CLO 2024.1 New Feature Highlights (English)
Transcript: hi my name is Phoebe and today we are going to go over some features from the new 20241 CL release there's a lot of new stuff in this release and we're so excited to share it with you so without further Ado let's dive on in we've made some updates to our UI especially at the top menu bar here you'll see that now to access close set and connect you can do that at the top menu bar and also we've added in production instead of editors so if I want to access closet I can easily just click here and I'll see all my closet options to go into connect I can select here and this is where I can access my everywhere feature where I'll also see some updates to this UI to just reflect the colors and fonts Chang and then in production that's where I'll see all of my old editors colorway bom and grade review if I want to find fabric creator that will be in Fabric and to find Avatar editor that's within Avatar we also have more avatars within our Avatar folder within our library here we have a metahuman folder where there are pre-loaded metahumans for you to use within CL just know you can't edit these within CL they have to be edited in the metahuman platform we also have more avatars in our connect Library so going into connect we have added in a faceless kid Avatar that's also adjustable within our Avatar editor now you can easily move around your Avatar's measurement Lines within CL so that it can match up closer to your own measurement positions moving into our Avatar editor you can see that we've made our UI a little bit simpler and easier to work with one really nice update is with this settings icon over here I now can select and choose which measure measurements I want to edit and see within my avatar editor I can then close out this window and see that update reflected here in my avatar editor another really nice update is the fact that you can now link and unlink the total width and total height to the below measurements so you can make it so that these measurement changes either reflect within all measurements or you can make it so that they're independent in the adjustments you can then really quickly and easily go through and add in all the measurement changes you want within the Avatar editor like so we've added in an option for crotch width within the Avatar editor this will allow you to adjust the width between the thighs the crotch we've also added more options for crotch for male avatars you'll have the crotch width option but you also have a crotch volume option as well which will adjust the volume of the crotch making it so fittings with Intimates and swim are a lot more accurate bringing files into has never been easier with our connection to Clos set in our library you can easily bring in closet files into CL and with this new update you can even bring in previous versions of a file into CL from close set applying seam allowance in CL has always been easy but with this new update it is now closer to Industry standard especially for darts so now when you add in seam allowance to our darts the default will be to cut into it but you still always have that option to apply different seam allowances for darts that match to Industry standards we have now made it so that the dart information stays even when you move or rotate the dart within CL so here if I rotate this Dart I'll keep my Baseline information even after it's rotated which allows for more consistency in the information of the pattern throughout Club you can now add fullness to even half symmetrical patterns using your fullness line tool in your 2D toolbar you can then go in and add in your fullness to this half symmetrical pattern piece easily and quickly when checking sewing you'll see that now when you want to change your sewing line type between turned on or off you can do that fairly easily either using the new shortcut key the apostrophe or the new UI update with the checkbox you can turn turned sewing line type on or off fairly quickly and easily we've now made it so that our buttons and button holes are linked when fastened together making it so when you change the button size you have the option to link the button hole to that button so you can adjust just your button size and it will automatically make it so the button hole adjusts with it making editing buttons even easier and faster within Club when you're finished with your garment you can save out the project but we also have this great update where you can save it into a modular Library where you can have all your blocks within this Library we actually have added in another update Auto modular labeling this will automatically label the patterns within your workspace to let you know which block sections they should be in adding in blocks to your modular library is the same process as before really quick and easy this allows you to create a whole library that you can then play with in the future now you can edit your style names within module Library easier than ever so you can select your Styles and if you want to edit the style name you can just easily do that renaming the style and also adding in a new thumbnail will also apply to all of the blocks as well which makes everything unified and stays together now with in the knitwear feature we've added the ability to adjust the the colorization of mange giving you control over the color positions and randomizations within your knit Yarns it's easier than ever to rotate your knit Direction within CL in your property editor you now have a slider where you can rotate the fabric direction of your knit quickly and easily now when creating artwork in Photoshop or other softwares and their color signature is IC or srgb CL will recognize those colors even better than before making it so that there's more color consistency between different softwares so what's great is now with Graphics you're going to have this option use same maap as fabric where you'll be able to link your fabric maps to your graphics so your normal map your opacity map your displacement map all of those can be linked so anything that you do in your fabric to those Maps will be seen with your graphic as well which will then create a great Blended look to your graphics which is really helpful for certain graphic effects using our new print type feature within CL you can quickly choose between different preset options we have for you to apply to our Graphics there's digital crack vintage gold foil and blend it all of these options make it so you can quickly and easily achieve the print effect that you want in CL faster and easier a really exciting new feature we have is the generate PBR Maps now in CL you can automatically generate all of your Maps through your texture map for everything all you have to do is go into this little icon next to your map and select it and that will generate that map for you and it will actually be a map that you can edit with our new color way we've created a more dynamic system within colorways to allow you to create more options within your colorway editor so now when you add in colorways you'll now have the flexibility of adding in colorways that can be adjusted for just materials or colorways that can be adjusted for all properties or you could bring colorways that are actually linked together all of this will allow you to create a range of different colorway options that will work within your specific workflows and allow more freedom to see your garments in different   options so going into the settings icon over here this is where you can actually access all of these options and you can do this both in a overall scale or you can do it on more of an individual scale so you can either pick an entire fabric section on how you want to add it or you can select individual Fabrics or individual top stitches or individual graphics on how you would like those to be added in or you could select the whole section you'll still be able to change out colors change out prints change out textures change sizes and also you'll be able to now change out fabric Properties or link colors if you need to all of these options are now open to you through this new colorway Improvement now you have two separate ways in which you can add in points of measure within Clow there is the segment line option and also the polyline option pressing the P key will allow you to switch between these two options the segment line option allows you to just follow pattern outlines easily and quickly while the polyline option will actually allow you to stop your measurement within your pattern which creates a little more of a dynamic measurement tool for you it even can create measurements outside of patterns as well allowing for an array of different points of measures all within your garment grading Graphics within CL has never been easy iier going into our grading tool you can then select your graphic and what we now have the option of is grading in percentages so now you can easily and quickly grade all of your graphics using percentages instead of measurements which makes grading even easier now within CL you can stack using internal lines which is is really helpful for a lot of different grading scenarios within grade review you now have the option to view in a panoramic view option so here are my view options I can change to panoramic which will then make it so all my avatars are within one window which is really nice for when you need to review all of your sizes at once or you want to review graphic placements or anything like that you can also rotate all of your avatars around to see what it's like in front side and back now using schematic render to get a sketch-like appearance you'll be able to see your zipper outline more clearly within this update now when you want to make adjustments to your Avatar's appearance you can use the style configurator and and what we've added within that is being able to also change out their eye color so you can still change the Hair Skin underwear eyebrows lips and now the eyes as well which is really great cuz you can now create really interesting avatars all within Club when you've created displacement maps and are in your render window we've made it so now there is no minimum for particle distance with your displacement Maps making it so even really fine Graphics like this can work really really well within CL because you can lower the particle distance to below one we now have this feature lock camera which when paired with interactive render will make it so that you can lock your render image to a specific Viewpoint and then freely move around within your 3D window to add in lights or change directions or anything like that and see how that will affect your rendered image making it so all of your changes you can see real time but also in your rendered camera angle so here I have a lot of different custom views that I would like to render out within CL you now can render all of your custom views individually and merge them all together in one image so that you can easily move and place and share your different viewpoints with other people quickly and easily like so once you finished rendering out your garment you now can use our new feature called the AI Avatar Studio which is right over here and what this will do is it's actually going to allow you to put a very realistic avatar on your rendered image so you can do this through either creating an AI Avatar like so going through the options creating out prompts or using random prompts editing those prompts and then what you can do is start to generate those AI Avatar faces once you get a face you'd like you can then generate it out and place that onto your avatar or if you want you can always go to the image option up top and here what you can actually do is bring in an image of any face that you have so here I'm actually going to do my face and then you can hit generate and then that will generate out your rendered image with your face on the Avatar this has really created a lot of interesting new rendering options within CL and will really help your e-commerce and other like marketing strategies that you want to do with your rendered images once the 3D file is completed and clo users can go to the cloud platform closet for further collaborations when you have logged into closet you may upload and share your 3D files with others in the new version of closet we have a new upload interface to streamline your upload process users can also directly drag and drop the files to the screen as an efficient way to upload multiple files at once the uploaded files can then be viewed in our live 3D viewer closet is providing other options in which to view your garment such as with garment fit Maps this will enhance your co-creation with other users we also have included a visual board within closet for creating presentations with your 3D Assets in the visual board users can mix and match different content such as the 3D garment fabric images color palettes and more to present the design and its concept the viewer of the visual board is able to view the 3D garment in the 3D linked viewer and the board can be shared to everyone by a hyperlink it can also be utilized in different stages of your design creation such as a mood board for concept development and cataloging for lion adoption making it easy and efficient to jump between CL and closet no matter where you are in your process thank you so much for watching and making it to the end if you want more tips and tricks on all of our new features check out the features Corner section on our YouTube page we have individual videos where I'll walk you through all the little things and fun facts about each feature have fun building with cl 20241 and keep on learning
Summary: # Comprehensive Guide to the 20241 CL Release Welcome to the comprehensive guide for the new features introduced in the 20241 CL release. This guide will provide step-by-step instructions, definitions, and helpful tips and tricks to assist you in navigating the new updates effectively. ## User Interface (UI) Updates ### Accessing Features from the Top Menu Bar 1. **New Menu Layout**: The top menu bar now provides direct access to **Closet**, **Set**, and **Connect**. - **Closet**: Click here to access all closet options. - **Connect**: Access the **Everywhere** feature and see UI updates reflecting new colors and fonts. - **Production**: This section contains old editor features like **Colorway**, **BOM**, and **Grade Review**. ### Accessing Fabric and Avatar Editor - **Fabric Creator**: Find this under the **Fabric** menu. - **Avatar Editor**: Look for this in the **Avatar** menu. ### New Avatar Features 1. **Metahuman Folder**: Contains pre-loaded metahumans that can't be edited within CL. 2. **Faceless Kid Avatar**: An adjustable avatar available in the **Connect Library**. 3. **Measurement Lines**: Easily move around avatar measurement lines to match your own measurements. ### Avatar Editor Simplifications 1. **Settings Icon**: Choose which measurements you want to see and edit. 2. **Linking Measurements**: You can link/unlink total width and height to the measurements below. 3. **Crotch Width and Volume Adjustments**: New options to adjust crotch width and volume for better fitting of intimates and swimwear. ### Importing Files from Closet - You can now import previous versions of files from Closet into CL easily. ## Seam Allowance and Pattern Adjustments 1. **Darts**: Seam allowance for darts now defaults to cutting into it, with options to match industry standards. 2. **Fullness Line Tool**: Add fullness to half-symmetrical patterns easily. 3. **Sewing Line Type**: Change sewing line type using the new shortcut key (apostrophe) or checkbox. ### Button and Buttonhole Functionality - Buttons and buttonholes are now linked; changing the button size will automatically adjust the buttonhole size. ## Saving and Modular Library Features 1. **Saving Projects**: Save your project into a modular library for future use. 2. **Auto Modular Labeling**: Automatically label patterns within your workspace for easier organization. 3. **Editing Style Names**: Rename styles and add thumbnails for better organization. ## Knitwear Features - Adjust colorization of yarns and easily rotate knit direction using a new slider in the property editor. ### Graphics and Color Consistency 1. **Linking Fabric Maps to Graphics**: Allows for seamless integration of fabric properties with graphics. 2. **Print Type Feature**: Quickly apply different print effects to graphics. 3. **Generate PBR Maps**: Automatically create maps from texture maps. ## Improved Colorway System 1. **Dynamic Colorway Creation**: Flexibility to add and adjust colorways for materials and linked properties. 2. **Point of Measure Options**: Two ways to add points of measure (Segment Line and Polyline). ## Grading Graphics - Grade graphics using percentages, making the process easier and more intuitive. ### Viewing Options - **Panoramic View**: View all avatars in one window during grade review. ## Avatar Customization 1. **Style Configurator**: Change avatar features, including eye color. 2. **Displacement Maps**: No minimum for particle distance, allowing for finer graphics. ### Rendering Features 1. **Lock Camera Feature**: Lock the render image to a specific viewpoint while making changes. 2. **Custom View Rendering**: Render multiple custom views and merge them into one image. ### AI Avatar Studio 1. **Creating AI Avatars**: Generate realistic avatars using prompts. 2. **Image Upload Option**: Upload an image to generate an avatar with your face. ## Cloud Collaboration with Closet 1. **Uploading 3D Files**: Streamlined upload interface with drag and drop functionality. 2. **Live 3D Viewer**: View uploaded files in a 3D environment. 3. **Visual Board Feature**: Create presentations using 3D assets, fabric images, and more. Share via hyperlink. ## Conclusion This guide covers the essential features and updates introduced in the 20241 CL release. For more tips and tricks, check out the **Features Corner** section on the YouTube page for detailed walkthroughs of each new feature. **Happy Designing!** Enjoy exploring the new functionalities and keep on learning!

Title: CLO User Summit 2024: NEW YORK CITY üöñ
Transcript: the reason we are having this user Summit today is we want to bring Enterprise clients as well as individual users or just overall General users that loves clo that utilizes clo we want to bring them all together so they can see what we have in our role mask we want them to utilize clo in a way that they might never did it before   my highlight from this event was meeting other people in different companies but in the same industry and sharing experiences main takeaway from this event is just the incredible collaboration amongst all the companies that are using Flo and the incredible future possibilities with what 3D and cl can do for the industry so we're just excited to be here and be surrounded by so many incredible people who are nerdy in the same ways that we are   n
Summary: # Comprehensive Guide to the User Summit for CLO ## Introduction The User Summit is designed to bring together enterprise clients and individual users who utilize CLO (an innovative 3D garment visualization and design tool). The event aims to foster collaboration, share experiences, and explore the future possibilities of CLO in the industry. --- ## Objectives of the User Summit 1. **Networking Opportunities**: Connect with other professionals in the industry to exchange ideas and experiences. 2. **Learning and Collaboration**: Discover new ways to utilize CLO and its features, enhancing your skills and knowledge. 3. **Future Insights**: Gain insights into the future of 3D technology and how CLO can revolutionize the industry. --- ## Step-by-Step Guide to Prepare for the User Summit ### Step 1: Registration - **Action**: Register for the User Summit via the official website or event platform. - **Tip**: Ensure you register early to secure your spot and receive event updates. ### Step 2: Familiarize Yourself with CLO - **Action**: If you are new or want to refresh your knowledge about CLO, take the time to explore its features. - **Resources**: Utilize online tutorials, webinars, and CLO‚Äôs official documentation. ### Step 3: Set Goals for the Event - **Action**: Define what you hope to achieve from attending the summit (e.g., learning new techniques, networking). - **Tip**: Write down specific questions or topics you want to discuss with other attendees. ### Step 4: Prepare for Networking - **Action**: Create a professional profile or digital business card to share with others. - **Tip**: Practice a brief introduction about yourself and your work with CLO. ### Step 5: Engage with the Community - **Action**: Join community forums or groups related to CLO to connect with other users before the event. - **Tip**: Participate in discussions to get insights and share your own experiences. --- ## Key Highlights During the Summit ### Networking Opportunities - **Action**: Attend networking sessions and workshops to meet other users and industry professionals. - **Tip**: Take notes about people you meet, including their names and roles, to follow up later. ### Collaboration Workshops - **Action**: Participate in collaborative workshops to explore innovative uses of CLO. - **Tip**: Be open to sharing your experiences and learning from others. ### Insights and Discussions - **Action**: Attend keynote speeches and panel discussions focusing on the future of 3D technology and CLO. - **Tip**: Ask questions during Q&A sessions to deepen your understanding. --- ## Post-Summit Follow-Up ### Step 1: Reflect on Your Experience - **Action**: Take some time to review your notes and reflect on the key takeaways from the event. - **Tip**: Identify at least three actionable items you can implement in your work. ### Step 2: Connect with New Contacts - **Action**: Reach out to the people you met at the summit via email or LinkedIn. - **Tip**: Personalize your message by mentioning something specific from your conversation. ### Step 3: Share Your Learnings - **Action**: Write a blog post or share insights on social media about your experience at the summit. - **Tip**: Use relevant hashtags to reach a broader audience and engage with the CLO community. --- ## Definitions ### CLO CLO (Creative Lab Outfit) is a 3D garment visualization tool used by fashion designers and companies to create and simulate clothing designs. ### User Summit An event that gathers CLO users from various backgrounds to share insights, experiences, and learn about new features and applications of the software. --- ## Tips and Tricks - **Stay Engaged**: Actively participate in discussions and workshops to make the most of the event. - **Follow Up**: After the summit, follow up with new contacts and continue the conversation to build relationships. - **Utilize Resources**: Take advantage of any materials, recordings, or resources provided during the summit for future reference. - **Explore New Features**: Be open to exploring features of CLO that you may not have used before to enhance your design process. --- ## Conclusion The User Summit is a unique opportunity to connect, learn, and collaborate with fellow CLO users. By following this comprehensive guide, you can maximize your experience and contribute to the vibrant community surrounding CLO.
